message: that does seem useful
http://techcrunch.com/2011/02/09/my6sense-twitter/
I like this extension, it's almost kind of magical how it knows the stuff I'm going to like and not like.
Pretty crazy when a computer seems to know me better than I know myself!
ha, when i first saw this i thought it was MySpace that was doing this
ah, so this is "top news" for twitter
i'm sure twitter must be working on something like this
i switch between "top news" and "most recent" on facebook all the time
I don't think there's anything they've put out as a product yet though, is there?
@ericflo no, twitter is still quite chronological
the article makes a distinction between relevancy based on user, and topic
Yeah, they might have internal tools
Twitter hasn't yet launched a relevancy solution. They will, of course.
the techcrunch article mentioned "whispers" of twitter working on something like facebook top news
yeah
facebook's top news does seem to be based on my interest in the person
But if you look at relevance and personalization, it's much more than a feature, just like search was more than a feature for portals.
helloooooooooooo
@louisgray You guys have first-mover advantage though
my6sense is focused on this space and it would be GREAT for everybody else to try in-house tools first. They'll find out it's pretty hard! :)
Facebook is focused on the social graph more than the content side of sharing today.
